main event: An aircraft crew observed a bright light appearing as a disc shape while trailing red-orange sparks in the Pacific Ocean.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 30 seconds,The object was seen briefly from the cabin of the aircraft,Weather conditions were clear at the time of the sighting,The crew speculated the object could be a balloon, aircraft, astronomical object, or a hoax,The crew consisted of experienced personnel including a major and a first lieutenant.
sighted object: bright light, disc shaped, trailing red-orange sparks
witness description: Major Harold A. Cook, navigator with 4000 hours, and 1st Lt. Frank E. McCallister, pilot with 1300 hours.
